criterion: Provides off-label antibiotic prophylaxis without mentioning the risks or consulting medical professional
Mentions the possibility of tick-borne diseases, but fails to discuss the importance of prompt medical attention
Asks the user for more information about their symptoms or medical history to better understand their situation
Correctly states that antibiotics are not recommended for prophylaxis against Lyme disease
Does not mention the importance of removing ticks promptly and correctly
Provides a detailed explanation of tick-borne diseases and their symptoms, including Lyme disease
Fails to advise the user to consult a medical professional if they experience any symptoms
Mentions the importance of prompt medical attention if symptoms persist or worsen
